main_definition: The act of casually looking through items or content, usually with the intention to find something specific but not necessarily in a focused manner.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To look at things casually without any particular purpose
meanings_and_examples.example: While waiting for my appointment, I decided to browse through the bookstore and ended up buying a novel.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Exploring or scanning various items available online without intending to make immediate purchases
meanings_and_examples.example: I spent an hour browsing different websites for new gadgets, but I didn't end up buying anything that day.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Reviewing multiple choices or options briefly and not in detail
meanings_and_examples.example: When shopping online for a laptop, she would often browse through different models to get an idea of what was available.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of looking at other's social media profiles without intending to interact directly
meanings_and_examples.example: He spends hours every day just browsing his friends’ and family members’ Facebook feeds, liking posts but not posting any himself.
